intro: Heterotheca chrysopsidis, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its blue to purple flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Heterotheca chrysopsidis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
